sentence: They did make a belated attempt to reduce the noise.

translation: nora [a hole in the ground dug by an animal such as a rabbit, especially to live in]
sentence: The chipmunk retreated to its burrow to have its babies.

translation: przedział [one of the separate areas inside a vehicle, especially a train]
sentence: The first class compartment is at the front of the train.

translation: łudzić [to make someone believe something that is not true]
sentence: He's deluding himself if he thinks he's going to be promoted this year.

translation: bać się, obawiać się [to feel extremely worried or frightened about something that is going to happen or that might happen]
sentence: He's dreading the exam - he's sure he's going to fail.

translation: drzeć, rozdzierać [literary; to tear or break something violently]
sentence: They rent their clothes in grief.

translation: goleń [the front part of your leg between your knee and your foot]
sentence: She has a nasty bruise on her shin.

translation: warczeć [(especially of dogs) to make a deep, rough sound while showing the teeth, usually in anger or (of people) to speak or say something angrily and forcefully]
sentence: The dogs started to snarl at each other so I had to separate them.

translation: rumak [literary; a horse that is ridden]
sentence: I spurred my panting steed and waved my sword.

translation: namacalny [real and not imaginary; able to be shown, touched, or experienced]
sentence: We need tangible evidence if we're going to take legal action.
